moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5 4. c3 Bb6: Book play through here, standard Giuoco Piano.
moves.6. d5: Not good. It closes the diagonal of the White KB and opens the diagonal of Black's.
moves.7. Be2: 7 O-O is much better. The B was fine where it was and White needed to think about finding shelter for the K.
moves.7... d6: Opening a line for the QB.
moves.8. h3: Losing more time. Again 8 O-O was the right move.
moves.8... f5: Looking to exploit White's nerveless play by opening the game up.
moves.9. Bg5: A wasted move, as Black has...
moves.10... O-O: Notice that Black *immediately* castles as soon as he gets the opportunity. Now he can go on the attack safely.
moves.11. Nh4: Missing his last chance to castkle.
moves.12... Nxe4: White can lose quickly or slowly. If he does not take the Q he is behind 2 pieces [after 13... QxB or ...QxN]. If he does...
